intro: Dimorphanthera dekockii, commonly known as the De Kock's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and striking coloration. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with moderate rainfall. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellow with intricate patterns, and it has a short flowering period. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
